title: The Flames of the Sky Realms

campaign_overview.theme: A heroic dragon adventure about destiny, friendship, and choosing your own path.
campaign_overview.tone_description: Epic but gentle. The world feels large and magical, but danger is never cruel or hopeless. Bravery and kindness matter more than strength.
campaign_overview.goal: Uncover the truth behind a growing conflict between dragon tribes and prevent a war that would devastate the Sky Realms.
campaign_overview.completion_condition: The hero helps reveal the truth behind the conflict and brings peace, understanding, or a lasting truce between the tribes.
player_experience_goals: Explore a world of flying dragons
Learn that destiny can be shaped

ruleset.system_name: Wings of Fire Light Adventure Rules

core_mechanics.failure_philosophy: Failure never stops the story. It adds complications, not dead ends.

character_basics.death_rules: Dragons are never killed. At zero hit points, they are exhausted, captured, or forced to retreat.

combat_rules.style: Light, turn based, and non graphic
combat_rules.combat_end_condition: Combat ends when the story outcome is clear, not when every enemy is defeated

MudWing.ability: Once per scene, automatically succeed at a strength based action

SandWing.ability: Once per fight, a successful attack can deal extra d6 damage with venom

SkyWing.ability: Once per scene, automatically succeed at a flying or chasing action

SeaWing.ability: Breathe underwater and gain advantage on water based actions once per scene

RainWing.ability: Once per scene, become invisible or perfectly camouflaged

IceWing.ability: Once per fight, freeze or slow an enemy instead of dealing damage

NightWing.ability: Once per session, ask the Dungeon Master one helpful question

HiveWing.ability: Once per scene, choose a minor special effect like poison or stun

SilkWing.ability: Once per scene, create silk or flamesilk for movement or light

LeafWing.ability: Once per scene, grow plants or vines to help or block paths
LeafWing.limitation: Powers are weaker in barren places

hybrid_rules.rule: Choose one ability from either parent tribe and keep both limitations

starting_state.location: High mountain ledge overlooking the Sky Realms
starting_state.location_description: A wide stone ledge clings to the side of a towering mountain. Far below, clouds drift over forests, deserts, oceans, and icy lands. Dragons of many colors soar through the sky.
known_facts: Dragon tribes rule different parts of the Sky Realms
Tension between the tribes is growing
Strange signs have appeared in the sky
starting_state.starting_expectation_for_dm: Begin with wonder and scale. Let the player feel the joy of flight and being a dragon.

acts.title: A Sign in the Sky
acts.purpose: Introduce the dragon world and the central mystery.
acts.narrative_summary: A strange light appears in the sky, seen by dragons across the realms. Some believe it is an omen of war. Others believe it is a call for peace.
key_elements: A glowing symbol in the clouds
possible_player_actions: Fly closer to investigate the sign
Volunteer to help as a messenger
acts.success_condition: The hero agrees to investigate the meaning of the sky sign.
acts.failure_guidance: If the hero hesitates, introduce a friendly elder dragon who explains why the sign matters.
acts.dm_notes: Emphasize mystery and curiosity rather than danger.

acts.title: The Divided Tribes
acts.purpose: Show the consequences of misunderstanding and fear.
acts.narrative_summary: The hero travels between different dragon lands and sees how fear is spreading. Each tribe believes the others are preparing for war.
key_elements: An icy cliff ruled by frost dragons
A scorching desert ruled by sand dragons
A stormy sea ruled by wave dragons
possible_player_actions: Look for evidence of who started the rumors
acts.success_condition: The hero discovers that the conflict is being fueled by lies or misunderstandings.
acts.failure_guidance: If the hero fails a roll, allow them to escape or learn partial information.
acts.dm_notes: Avoid villains at this stage. Focus on fear and confusion.

acts.title: Choosing the Future
acts.purpose: Resolve the conflict and give the hero a defining choice.
acts.narrative_summary: The truth is revealed. The hero must decide how to present it and what future the Sky Realms will follow.
key_elements: The truth behind the sky sign
A choice between force or peace
acts.success_condition: The hero prevents war and shapes a peaceful future for the Sky Realms.
acts.failure_guidance: If negotiations fail, allow one last bold or clever action.
acts.dm_notes: Make the ending feel earned and hopeful.

locations.name: Sky Ledge
locations.description: A high mountain ledge where young dragons learn to fly and watch the world below.

locations.name: Frost Cliffs
locations.description: Tall icy cliffs where frost dragons carve their homes from ice.

locations.name: Ember Desert
locations.description: A vast desert of red sand and stone where heat shimmers in the air.

npcs.name: Aurelion
npcs.motivation: Wants to prevent history from repeating itself

npcs.name: Pyrris
npcs.motivation: Believes war is the only solution

completion_rewards.story_reward: The hero becomes known as a dragon who changed the fate of the Sky Realms.

rules: Let flight feel exciting and free.
Use dice rolls for risky flying, persuasion, or daring stunts.
dm_guidance.completion_behavior: When peace is secured, describe the skies clearing, dragons flying together, and clearly state that the adventure is complete.
